titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Lechoslaw Gawlikowski interviews
titlestmt.author: Processed by Hoover Institution Archives Staff.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-05-20T09:06-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Sound recordings of interviews of former Radio Free Europe Polish Service employees, relating to Radio Free Europe broadcasts to Poland. Also includes selected Radio Free Europe broadcast recordings.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lechoslaw Gawlikowski interviews, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2009.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Lechoslaw (Leszek) Gawlikowski was born on June 13, 1946 in Poland. He graduated with an MA from the from the Szkoła Główna Planowania i Statystyki (Warsaw School of Economics). As a student, he worked at Polish Students Association in Warsaw, and after graduation, as a member of the editorial Board of the?Young Cinema and Theatre quarterly in Prague, as well as the cultural editor for the publications of the International Union of Students. Since 1972, he has lived in the Federal Republic of Germany, joining Polish Broadcasting Department of the Radio Free Europe in Munich as an editor trainee, the editor at the Polish Newsroom, economic editor, and Assistant Director and Deputy Director of the Polish Broadcasting Department from 1988 to 1994. He also served as a Senior Advisor for the Archives of the RFE/RL Inc. from 1995 to 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Sound recordings of interviews of former Radio Free Europe Polish Service employees, relating to Radio Free Europe broadcasts to Poland. Also includes selected Radio Free Europe broadcast recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Commercial CD set: Z ARCHIWUM ROZGLOSNI POLSKIEJ RADIA WOLNA EUROPA

CD1: Fragmenty wybranych audycji dotyczacych wydarzen z lat 1952-1981 CD2: Fragmenty wybranych audycji dotyczacych wydarzen z lat 1982-1994 CD3: Historia Polski 1914-1945 - wspomnienia uczestnikow najwazniejszych wydarzen CD4: Fragmenty wybranych audycji dotyczacych literatury, muzyki, satyry i sportu

did.unittitle: Mowi Radio Wolna Europa: Fragmenty audycji Rozglosni Polskiej RWE

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Kompozycja i montaz - Maciej J. Drygas Wspolpraca - Katarzyna Maciejko-Kowalczyk Realizacja dzwieku - Iwo Klimek (I.M.I. Studio) Projekt okladki - Danuta Blahut-Bieganska
Wykorzystano malerialy dzwiekowe z fonoteki RWE, przechowywane w Archiwum Dokumentacji Mechanicznej w Warszawie

Redakcja "Karty" dziekuje za pomoc: A. Ross Johnsonowi, Hoover Institution, Lechoslawowi Gawlikowskiemu, ostatniemu wicedyrektorowi Rozglosni Polskiej RWE, Piotrowi Musurowi, kierownikowi Dzialu Dzwiekowego ADM
